DOC.brief_summary: This study randomize control trial efficacy inspiratory muscle train swim performance , airway dysfunction perceive breathlessness elite swimmer .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Inspiratory Muscle Training Elite Swimmers
DOC.detailed_description: Only study assess impact Inspiratory Muscle Training ( IMT ) swim performance unclear inconsistent result . This study aim evaluate effect 12-week IMT program swimming performance , airway dysfunction perceive breathlessness among elite swimmer . Participants recruit elite competitive Futebol Clube Porto swim team . After consent , individual randomly allocate IMT Sham-IMT group . A pressure threshold device use perform inspiratory training . The IMT group perform 30 inspiratory effort , 5 time week , twice day , pressure threshold load equivalent 50 % maximal inspiratory pressure ( MIP ) . Sham-IMT group follow similar protocol , except inspiratory effort make 15 % MIP . Measures lung function , swim performance , airway dysfunction , inspiratory muscle strength perceive breathlessness assess begin 4 week interval end study period . All outcome measure assess investigator involve intervention process . Data express mean ± standard deviation ( SD ) respective 95 % confidence interval . The significance level 5 % ( p˂0.05 ) .
DOC.criteria: Healthy elite swimmer engage competitive training minimum period three year ; Individuals disability ; Individuals age 14 40 year . Individuals present comorbidities physical impairment affect regular training ; Smokers ; Athletes already regular respiratory muscle train program Individuals predict forced expiratory volume first second ( FEV1 ) 60 % .
